bill_title: require a removal agency to notify certain persons after removing certain motor vehicles.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require a removal agency to notify a county sheriff after removing certain motor vehicles. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-30 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If any removal agency as defined by § 32-36-2 removes any motor vehicle from a public street or highway and the removal is not at the request of a law enforcement officer, the removal agency shall report the removal to the county sheriff within twenty-four hours of removing the motor vehicle. Failure to make a report as provided by this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. That chapter 32-30 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If a removal agency fails to make a report as required by section 1 of this Act, the removal agency is not entitled to any towing or storage fees for the removed vehicle and no such towing or storage fees may be billed or collected by the removal agency. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require a removal agency to notify a county sheriff or chief of police after removing certain motor vehicles. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-30 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If any removal agency as defined by § 32-36-2 removes any motor vehicle from a public street or highway and the removal is not at the request of a law enforcement officer, the removal agency shall report the removal to the county sheriff, if the removal occurred outside any municipality, or to the chief of police, if the removal occurred inside any municipality, within twenty-four hours of removing the motor vehicle. Failure to make a report as provided by this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. That chapter 32-30 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If a removal agency fails to make a report as required by section 1 of this Act, the removal agency is not entitled to any towing or storage fees for the removed vehicle and no such towing or storage fees may be billed or collected by the removal agency. BILL HISTORY 1/18/00 First read in House and referred to Local Government. H.J. 116 1/27/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/1/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/1/00 Local Government Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 13, NAYS 0. H.J. 337 2/1/00 Local Government Place on Consent Calendar.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require a removal agency to notify a county sheriff or chief of police after removing certain motor vehicles. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-30 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If any removal agency as defined by § 32-36-2 removes any unattended motor vehicle from a public street or highway and the removal is not at the request of a law enforcement officer, the removal agency shall report the removal to the county sheriff, if the removal occurred outside any municipality, or to the chief of police, if the removal occurred inside any municipality, within twenty-four hours of removing the motor vehicle. Failure to make a report as provided by this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. That chapter 32-30 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If a removal agency fails to make a report as required by section 1 of this Act, the removal agency is not entitled to any towing or storage fees for the removed vehicle and no such towing or storage fees may be billed or collected by the removal agency. FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require a removal agency to notify a county sheriff or chief of police after removing certain motor vehicles. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-30 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If any removal agency as defined by § 32-36-2 removes any unattended motor vehicle from a public street or highway and the removal is not at the request of the owner, an authorized agent of the owner, or a law enforcement officer, the removal agency shall report the removal to the county sheriff, if the removal occurred outside any municipality, or to the chief of police, if the removal occurred inside any municipality, within twenty-four hours of removing the motor vehicle. Failure to make a report as provided by this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. That chapter 32-30 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If a removal agency fails to make a report as required by section 1 of this Act, the removal agency is not entitled to any towing or storage fees for the removed vehicle and no such towing or storage fees may be billed or collected by the removal agency. FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require a removal agency to notify certain persons after removing certain motor vehicles. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-30 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If any removal agency as defined by § 32-36-2 removes any unattended motor vehicle from a public street or highway and the removal is not at the written request of the owner, an authorized agent of the owner, or a law enforcement officer, the removal agency shall report the removal to the owner within twenty-four hours of removing the motor vehicle. However, if the removal agency is unable to contact the owner, the removal agency shall report the removal to the county sheriff, if the removal occurred outside any municipality, or to the chief of police, if the removal occurred inside any municipality, within twenty-four hours of removing the motor vehicle. Failure to make a report as provided by this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. That chapter 32-30 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If a removal agency fails to make a report as required by section 1 of this Act, the removal agency is not entitled to any towing or storage fees for the removed vehicle and no such towing or storage fees may be billed or collected by the removal agency.
